definition: to pour oil on the fire (idiom); fig. to aggravate a situation/to enrage people and make matters worse
fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86
surname Huo
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)
see 上聲|上声[shang3 sheng1]
to pour liquid/to irrigate (using waterwheel)/to water/to cast (molten metal)/to mold
oil/fat/grease/petroleum/to apply tung oil, paint or varnish/oily/greasy/glib/cunning

sentences.english: European commissioner Chris Patten caught the mood when he suggested yesterday that Israel had dealt with a fire by pouring gasoline on the flames.
sentences.chinese: 欧盟外委会专员彭定康称，以色列这是往火上浇油。

sentences.english: You don’t have to rub it in. I already feel bad enough as it is.
sentences.chinese: 你不要火上浇油了，我已经够难过的。

sentences.english: China urges not to 'pour oil on flames'.
sentences.chinese: 中国警告美日韩三方不要火上浇油。

sentences.english: American officials fear the exchange of fire on Tuesday will provide yet another irritant for both sides.
sentences.chinese: 美政府官员担心周二的交火是在为双方关系火上浇油。

sentences.english: My previous girlfriend was younger than me, as well, so that just adds fuel to the fire.
sentences.chinese: 我以前的女友都是比我小，这无异于火上浇油。

definition: to add oil to the fire (idiom); fig. to aggravate a situation/to enrage people and make matters worse
to use the current topic to put over one's own ideas/to use sth as a pretext to make a fuss
to invite trouble
to add hail to snow (idiom); one disaster on top of another/to make things worse in a bad situation
to throw stones at sb who fell down a well (idiom); to hit a person who is down
to wish for the whole world to be in chaos (idiom)
pinyin: wei2 kong3 tian1 xia4 bu4 luan4

definition: to push the wave and add to the billows (idiom); to add momentum/to encourage sth to get bigger/to add fuel to the fire
to court disaster (idiom)/to dig one's own grave
to take drastic measures to deal with a situation/to pull the carpet from under sb
to be more of a hindrance than a help
stir up the fire and you get burnt (idiom); to get one's fingers burnt/fig. to suffer on account of one's own meddling
to infuriate/to enrage/to exasperate
to encourage/to foster/to foment
to incite disharmony/to instigate
to crush one's own foot while trying to maneuver a rock (to a cliff edge, to drop on one's enemy) (idiom)/hoisted by one's own petard
pinyin: ban1 qi3 shi2 tou5 za2 zi4 ji3 de5 jiao3

definition: to ask for trouble (idiom)/to make a rod for one's own back
